description:
OVERVIEW

Naterra International is a Coppell, TX-based sales and marketing company with an established portfolio of products including but not limited to HBC, Baby Care, and Personal Care Categories. Working at Naterra you will get the opportunity to work in a diverse environment with a team that is committed to manufacturing personal care products of the highest quality. At Naterra we believe that everyone deserves self-care without compromise.

At Naterra our core values are Candor, Teamwork, and Innovation and we expect team members to bring these skills to the work that they do. If you have a strong work ethic, critical thinking skills, and are an excellent communicator then we may have the perfect opportunity for you!

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

Do you have experience in Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) and feel up for a new challenge and an opportunity to advance your career?

We’re looking for a Director of Data Analytics and Information Technology to drive optimization within our data products and software tools that contribute to data-driven decision-making for Naterra. This role requires a mixture of technical proficiency, analytical rigor, and strategic thinking to facilitate a growth mindset for the company. This role will require you to work closely with multiple departments across the organization. As a leader within the organization, you will manage direct reports.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL DUTIES

Data Analytics Duties
• Utilize data and insights to be the unbiased voice of consumer, sales, marketing, and brand performance for all departments and the Naterra brand portfolio.
• Maintain and proactively develop in-depth knowledge of the business and our consumer segments, brand reputation, competitive environment, consumer/industry trends, and overall brand challenges & opportunities.
• Lead the organization’s business intelligence functions to empower data-driven decision-making in strategic initiatives that drive business growth from white space analysis to category competitive analysis, and execution plans.
• Act as the liaison for data and analytics projects within the organization building strong relationships between members of the Data Analytics team and key stakeholders.
• Ability to understand internal and external data such as Shipments (both inbound and outbound), Retailer Point of Sale data, and Consumer Insights data. Ensure the Data Analytics team provides ongoing tracking, analysis, and measurement of business trends and growth opportunities.
• Empower data-driven decision-making through an understanding of business needs and technical solutions to support strategic objectives.
• Facilitate training and education to increase knowledge of the cross-functional team and meet learning needs.
• Actively seek out and generate new and innovative ways to retrieve, visualize, and analyze data across a variety of operational, geological, and financial data sources.
• Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to make important decisions based on various facts and trends.
• Identify, address, and document areas for process improvement and automation in our data flow

Information Technology Duties
• Manage the IT and Data infrastructure for the organization.
• Lead and provide direction for enterprise technology and processes including IT technology and software solutions that support business priorities.
• Manage various IT partners including MSP and other 3rd party support teams.
• Provide support and guidance for IT initiatives including assessing risks and opportunities to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization functions within the Supply Chain, Warehouse, Quality, Product Development, Sales, etc.
• Negotiate and manage IT budgets and vendor partnerships ensuring quality and satisfaction are met for the cross-functional organization with a focus on improving costs/value of service to deliver ROI.
• Determine the technical needs of the organization, impart knowledge and use of data and analytical tools to drive insight into our lines of business to drive revenue, and cost reduction and improve the cross-functional team experience.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING
• 5-7 years of leadership experience in data management and analytics working in the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) industry with strong business insight and ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical counterparts.
• Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree preferred in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field.
• General understanding of infrastructure platforms and technologies, e.g., personal computers, servers, network applications, windows, etc.
• Curiosity for the business and experience working in a fast-paced environment.
• Strong problem-solving capabilities and a track record of finding solutions to complex problems.
• Knowledge and a general understanding of the CPG industry.
• Experience working within a P&L and managing an expense budget.
• Proven management experience- as evidenced by previous roles with responsibility for people management, strategy, and execution of data strategies that positively impact business outcomes.
• Excellent knowledge of sales analysis and metrics including retailer-specific POS systems and syndicated data sources like Nielsen, IRI, Numerator, or Tableau.
• Strong technical problem-solving skills, with an ability to troubleshoot complex issues.
• Demonstrated leadership, and proven ability to work collaboratively with a team, provide strategic insight, and influence management.
• Strong analytical skills and ability to simplify data into actionable, digestible insights.

WHAT WE OFFER
• Competitive salary plus bonus structure
• Annual bonus program of up to 35% based on company metrics
• Career pathing and development
• Medical / Dental / Vision / Life
• Matching 401k up to 4%
